translation: Song Dynasty Buddhism of the Tripiṭaka of Kāśmīra

source_sentence: 共竺道生等譯
translation: Together with the translations by Zhu Daosheng and others

translation: the third part of the four precepts for bodhisattvas

source_sentence: 佛在王舍城。
translation: The Buddha was in the city of Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 爾時外道、沙門、婆羅門月八日、十四日、十五日，共集一處和合布薩說法，多有眾人來往供養。
translation: On the eighth, fourteenth, and fifteenth days of each month non-Buddhists, renunciants, as well as śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas gathered together in one place to preach the Dharma. Many people came here and there to make offerings.

source_sentence: 瓶沙王見之，作是念：「若正法弟子亦如是者，不亦善乎！
translation: Seeing him, King Vaiśravaṇa thought, If the disciple of the right teaching is likewise, wouldn't it be good!

source_sentence: 我當率諸官屬往彼聽法，恭敬供養，令一切人長夜獲安。」
translation: I will lead my officials there to listen to the teaching, venerate and make offerings to it, so that all people will attain peace for a long time.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊亦作是念：「我為諸比丘結戒，而諸比丘有不聞者，不能誦學，不能憶持。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān also had this thought, I've established the precepts for the monks, but there are some monks who haven't heard them and can't recite or retain them.

source_sentence: 我今當聽諸比丘布薩說戒。」
translation: Now, I will listen to the monks and nuns who preach the precepts.

source_sentence: 瓶沙王念已到佛所，頭面禮足，却坐一面，以所念白佛。
translation: Having thought thus, King Bimbisāra approached the Buddha. After honoring him by bowing his forehead at his feet, he withdrew to sit at one side and reported this thought to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛為王說種種妙法，示教利喜已，即便還宮。
translation: The Buddha taught the king various wonderful teachings, and after showing them how to benefit and delight in it, he returned to his palace.

source_sentence: 佛以是事集比丘僧，以瓶沙王所白及己所念，告諸比丘：「今以十利故，聽諸比丘布薩說戒。」
translation: The Buddha gathered the monks and nuns for this reason, took what the king of Vaiśravaṇa said and what he thought, and told the monks, Now, for the sake of the ten benefits, I'll listen to the monks who preach the precepts.

source_sentence: 佛既聽布薩說戒，諸比丘便日日布薩。
translation: After the Buddha had heard the precepts taught by the bodhisattva, the monks then taught them day after day.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「不應爾！」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, You shouldn't!

source_sentence: 諸比丘復二日、三日至五日一布薩。
translation: It's another two days, three days, or five days for the monks.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「亦不應爾！
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, and he said, So it shouldn't be!

source_sentence: 聽月八日、十四日說法，十五日布薩。」
translation: He'll hear the teaching on the eighth and fourteenth days of the month, and he'll preach it on the fifteenth day.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知應說何法，以是白佛，佛言：「應讚歎三寶、念處、正懃、神足、根、力、覺、道。
translation: The monks didn't know what teaching to teach, so they said this to the Buddha, who said, You should praise the Three Treasures, the mindful abode of mindfulness, right effort, miraculous abilities, faculties, powers, enlightenment, and the path.

source_sentence: 為諸施主讚歎諸天。」
translation: For the sake of the donors, they praise the gods.

source_sentence: 諸比丘便合聲讚歎三寶，以是白佛，佛言：「不應爾！
translation: The monks then joined their voices in praise of the Three Treasures and said this to the Buddha, who said, No!

source_sentence: 聽請一人。」
translation: He's invited by one person.

source_sentence: 諸比丘請破戒、破見比丘，因此得勢。
translation: The monks asked the monks who broke the precepts and violated views to break them, and because of this they gained momentum.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「不應爾！
translation: Because of this, he said to the Buddha, who said, That's not right!

source_sentence: 應請學戒者。」
translation: You should invite someone who trains in the precepts.

source_sentence: 諸比丘復請睞眼諸病比丘，毀辱眾僧者。
translation: The monks again asked the eye-possessed sick monks to disgrace the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「不應爾！
translation: Because of this, he said to the Buddha, who said, That's not right!

source_sentence: 應請諸根具足，成就記論，持阿含者。」
translation: You should request that your faculties be complete, accomplish the memory treatise, and maintain the Āgamas.

source_sentence: 時眾中多有此人，諸比丘不知請誰。
translation: Many of the monks in the assembly didn't know who to invite.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應次第請。」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, You should ask in order.

source_sentence: 所請比丘說法疲極，以是白佛，佛言：「應更請代。」
translation: The invited monk was exhausted from teaching the Dharma and therefore told the Buddha, who said, You should ask me to take his place.

source_sentence: 諸比丘作歌詠聲說法，以是白佛，佛言：「不應爾！」
translation: The monks chanted and explained the teaching in song and therefore told the Buddha, who said, That's not right!

source_sentence: 說法時眾會不得盡聞，以是白佛，佛言：「應敷高座在上說法。」
translation: When he taught the Dharma, the congregation couldn't hear it all and therefore told the Buddha, who said, You should spread out a high seat up there to teach the Dharma.

source_sentence: 猶不盡聞，以是白佛，佛言：「應立聽。」
translation: They still didn't fully hear it, so they said to the Buddha, who said, You should stand and listen.

source_sentence: 久立脚腫，以是白佛，佛言：「應行聽。」
translation: After standing there for a long time, his feet became swollen and he said this to the Buddha, who said, Listen as you go.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘露地布薩，為蚊虻、風雨、塵土所困。
translation: The monks then spread their robes in the open air and were trapped by mosquitoes, gadflies, wind, rain, dust, and dirt.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「聽作布薩堂。」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, and he said, Listen to me as you build a buddha hall.

source_sentence: 彼布薩堂無地敷，污諸比丘脚，數洗生病。
translation: The poṣā hall had no floor space, soiled the monks' feet, and frequently washed away sickness.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應以泥塗地，淨治令好；
translation: Because of this he said to the Buddha, “You should anoint the earth with mud and make it clean and beautiful.

source_sentence: 亦聽敷十種衣及婆婆等柔軟草。」
translation: They'll also be allowed to spread out ten kinds of clothing and such soft grass as bamboo.

source_sentence: 佛既聽敷衣，便以錦布地。
translation: When the Buddha heard that his robes had been spread out, he spread them on the ground with brocade.

source_sentence: 諸居士見，譏訶言：「此諸沙門如王大臣！」
translation: Seeing them, the monks criticized them, saying, These ascetics are like king ministers!

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「不應錦上經行！」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, You shouldn't practice on brocaded silk!

source_sentence: 時諸比丘以華散高座上比丘，諸居士譏訶言：「如王大臣！」
translation: The monks then scattered flowers on top of the monk's high seat and the householders criticized him, saying, Just like the king's minister!

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「不應爾！」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, You shouldn't!

source_sentence: 復有諸白衣，為供養法故，欲以華散高座上比丘；
translation: Again, some white-robed bhikṣus wished to scatter flowers over the monks on a raised seat in order to make offerings to the Dharma.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不聽，便瞋訶言：「諸比丘不堪受供養！」
translation: The monks won't listen, and then angrily reprimanded them, saying, Monks, it's unworthy of offerings!

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「白衣欲散華隨意，若落比丘頭及衣上，應拂去，落高座上無苦。」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, Whoever wishes to scatter flowers in white robes as he wishes, if they fall on the monk's head or clothing, he should brush them away and drop them on a high seat without suffering.

source_sentence: 時諸白衣聞法歡喜，欲布施。
translation: The white robes then heard the teaching and rejoiced, wanting to give it as a gift.

source_sentence: 諸比丘恐墮客作，數不敢受。
translation: The monks were afraid of falling into the guest's work, and they didn't dare to accept it often.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「為法供養聽受。」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, Make offerings for the sake of the Dharma and listen.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘說法少時便止，諸天鬼神謂竟便去；
translation: When the bhikṣus stopped preaching the Dharma for a short time, the gods and ghosts departed.

source_sentence: 須臾復說，彼復來還，如是非一，便瞋恨言：「此諸比丘不齊限說法，如小兒戲！」
translation: After a moment, he spoke again, and when they came back, if there was one right or wrong, they became angry and said, These monks don't teach the Dharma with equal limitations, just like children playing!

source_sentence: 諸比丘以是白佛，佛言：「應作齊限說法，說法竟，應呪願。」
translation: The monks therefore reported this to the Buddha, who said, You should make a limited number of teachings, and when you finish teaching them, you should make a vow by spell.

source_sentence: 爾時劫賓那住乙師羅山，作是念：「我今當往僧集會處布薩不？」
translation: It was then that Kapphiṇa stayed at Mount Ethila and thought, Now, will I go to the place where the saṃgha gathered to preach?

source_sentence: 復作是念：「我常清淨，何須復往？」
translation: Again, he thought, I'm always pure; why would I need to go back?

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知其所念，於王舍城沒涌出其前，就座而坐，語言：「汝莫作是念：『我常清淨，何須復往布薩？』
translation: Knowing what he thought, the Bhagavān then emerged from the city of Rājagṛha and took his seat in front of him, said, Don't think, 'I'm always pure; why would I need to go back to the poṣā?'

source_sentence: 若汝等不往，不敬重布薩，誰當敬重者？」
translation: If you don't go there and don't venerate the bodhisattva, who will venerate him?

source_sentence: 世尊如是教已，便與俱沒彼處，出王舍城，以是事集比丘僧，說劫賓那念及己教勅，告諸比丘：「今聽諸比丘和合布薩，若不往，突吉羅。」
translation: After the Bhagavān had thus instructed them, he went with Kauṇḍinya to that place and left Rājagṛha, assembled the monks and nuns for this reason, explained Kapphiṇa's thoughts and his own instructions, and told the monks, Now, listen to the monks who harmonize their precepts and if they don't go, it's a grave offense.

source_sentence: 應一知法比丘，若上座、若上座等，說言：「大德僧聽！
translation: You should have one monk who knows the teaching, a superior seat or a superior seat and so forth, say, Listen, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 今十五日布薩說戒，僧一心作布薩說戒。
translation: Now, on the fifteenth day, he preaches the precepts, and the saṃgha unified his mind to preach the precepts.

source_sentence: 若僧時到僧忍聽。
translation: If the saṃgha arrives at the saṃgha's time, the saṃgha will tolerate listening.

source_sentence: 白如是。」
translation: The white is like this.

source_sentence: 「諸大德！
translation: “O great virtuous ones!

source_sentence: 今布薩說波羅提木叉，一切共聽，善思念之。
translation: Now, the bodhisattva teaches prātimokṣa, which is listened to by all and well-considered.

source_sentence: 若有罪應發露，無罪者默然。
translation: If there's a sin, it should be revealed, and if there's no sin, he remains silent.

source_sentence: 默然故，當知我及諸大德清淨；
translation: Because of being silent, you should know that I and my great virtues are pure.

source_sentence: 如聖默然，我及諸大德亦如是。
translation: Just as the noble ones are silent, so are I and my great virtues.

source_sentence: 若比丘如是眾中，乃至三唱，憶有罪不發露，得故妄語罪。
translation: If a monk thus enters the congregation, or even three times recites it, and remembers sins without revealing them, he'll be guilty of the offense of lying.

source_sentence: 故妄語罪，佛說遮道法，發露者得安樂。」
translation: That's why it's a sin of lying, for which the Buddha teaches the method of refuting the path and those who reveal it will attain well-being.

source_sentence: 是中波羅提木叉者：以此戒防護諸根，增長善法，於諸善法最為初門故，名為波羅提木叉；
translation: Because these precepts guard the faculties with these precepts and develop good factors. Because they are the first among all good factors, they are called prātimokṣa.

source_sentence: 復次數此戒法分別名句，總名為波羅提木叉。
translation: To further count the names and phrases of these precepts, they're collectively called prātimokṣa.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知應幾種布薩，以是白佛，佛言：「有五種布薩：一、心念口言；
translation: The bhikṣus, not knowing how many forms of the bodhisattva should be taught, said this to the Buddha:

source_sentence: 二、向他說淨；
translation: The second is the purity of teaching others.

source_sentence: 三、廣略說戒；
translation: The third is the extensive and brief explanation of the precepts.

source_sentence: 四、自恣布薩；
translation: The fourth is self-restraint in preaching.

source_sentence: 五、和合布薩。」
translation: 5. the combined bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知應幾種說戒，以是白佛，佛言：「有五種說戒：一、說戒序已，言餘僧所常聞；
translation: The bhikṣus, not knowing how many forms of preaching the precepts should be taught, therefore said this to the Buddha. The Buddha said:

source_sentence: 二、說戒序及四墮法已，言餘僧所常聞；
translation: The second is that after they have explained the introduction to the precepts and the fourfold doctrine of salvation, they will always be heard by the other members of the sangha.

source_sentence: 三、說戒序至十三，言餘僧所常聞；
translation: The third is to preface the preaching of the precepts up to the thirteenth, saying that they are always heard by other monks.

source_sentence: 四、說戒序至二不定法，言餘僧所常聞；
translation: The fourth explains the preface to the precepts up to two indeterminate factors, saying that they are always heard by other monks.

source_sentence: 五、廣說。」
translation: 5. explain it in detail.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知有幾種持律，以是白佛。
translation: The monks didn't know how many kinds of observance of the precepts there are, so they reported this to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛言：「有五種持律。」
translation: The Buddha said, There are five kinds of observing precepts.

source_sentence: 如前說。
translation: It's as explained above.

source_sentence: 「持律比丘有五種功德。」
translation: A monk who upholds the precepts has five kinds of merit.

source_sentence: 亦如前說。
translation: It's likewise as explained above.

source_sentence: 持律比丘有七種宜：一、多聞諸法；
translation: A monk who keeps the precepts has seven kinds of appropriateness:

source_sentence: 二、能籌量是法、非法；
translation: The second is that they are able to discern what is true and what is false.

source_sentence: 三、善籌量比尼；
translation: The third was the nun Shanjueumi pini (Samantavyūha).

source_sentence: 四、善攝師教；
translation: The fourth is that they skillfully collect the teachings of their teachers.

source_sentence: 五、若到他處，所說無畏；
translation: The fifth is fearlessness in going to another place and explaining what they teach.

source_sentence: 六、自住比尼；
translation: The sixth were the nuns who lived there themselves.

source_sentence: 七、知共、不共戒。
translation: 7. knowing the shared and distinctive precepts.

source_sentence: 復有七宜：一、自住戒，威儀成就，畏慎小罪；
translation: Again, there are seven kinds of appropriateness:

source_sentence: 二、多聞，能持佛所說法；
translation: The second is that they are learned, being able to preserve the teachings taught by buddhas.

source_sentence: 三、誦二部戒；
translation: The third is the morality of reciting the twofold doctrine.

source_sentence: 四、知犯；
translation: The fourth is knowledge of the transgressions.

source_sentence: 五、知不犯；
translation: The fifth is knowledge of non-violation.

source_sentence: 六、知悔過；
translation: The sixth is knowledge of repentance.

source_sentence: 七、知不悔過。
translation: 7. knowing and not repenting.

source_sentence: 復有七宜：三如上；
translation: Again, there are seven kinds of appropriateness:

source_sentence: 四、不隨愛；
translation: The fourth is not attached to craving.

source_sentence: 五、不隨恚；
translation: The fifth is that they do not comply with disputes.

source_sentence: 六、不隨癡；
translation: The sixth is that they do not follow delusion.

source_sentence: 七、不隨畏。
translation: 7. fear of not following.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘在界內，作別眾，不如法布薩；
translation: When the bhikṣus were within the boundary, they made separate congregations but did not preach the Dharma according to the proper rules.

source_sentence: 復有和合，不如法布薩；
translation: Again, there is another combination that does not conform to the rules for preaching the Dharma.

source_sentence: 復有如法，別眾布薩；
translation: Again, there is another doctrine that establishes a separate set of precepts for all buddhas.

source_sentence: 復有如法，和合布薩。
translation: Again, there's the combined bodhisattva who teaches according to the teaching.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「前三布薩有過，羯磨不成，犯突吉羅。
translation: That's why he said to the Buddha, who said, The first three precepts are wrong, and if the karma isn't fulfilled, it's a violation of the grave offense.

source_sentence: 後一布薩無過，羯磨成就，無犯。」
translation: The latter is not wrong, and it's not a violation when the karma is accomplished.

source_sentence: 爾時瓶沙王作五歲一閏，外道、沙門、婆羅門皆悉依承，而諸比丘獨不肯用。
translation: It was then that King Bimbisāra made a five-year leap, and non-Buddhist monks, as well as śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas all relied on it, but the monks were alone unwilling to use it.

source_sentence: 諸臣及民皆譏訶言：「沙門釋子在王境內，不用王閏。」
translation: The ministers and the people all criticized him, saying, The ascetic or Śākyamuni is inside the king's territory, so he doesn't need the king's leniency.

source_sentence: 諸比丘以是白佛，佛言：「應隨王法。」
translation: The monks therefore reported this to the Buddha, who said, You should follow the king's teaching.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知云何隨王法？
translation: The monks didn't know how to follow the king's teaching.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「聽少一夜布薩。」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, Listen for a little overnight's almsbowl.

source_sentence: 諸比丘便常少一夜布薩，以是白佛，佛言：「不應常少一夜布薩！
translation: The monks then always had a short night's almsbowl, so they said this to the Buddha, who said, You shouldn't always have a short night's almsbowl!

source_sentence: 聽三足一少，如是五歲，為長一月，以順王閏。」
translation: It's heard that the three-legged one is five years old, so it's one month long and follows the king's leap.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘說戒日至諸處布薩，或遇野火、或遇水漲、或遭八月賊，有梵行難、衣鉢難、命難。
translation: When the monks preach the precepts until they're upheld in various places, some may encounter a wildfire, some water rising, or an eighth-month thief, who has difficulty with religious practice, difficulty with clothing and bowls, and difficulty with life.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「不應說戒日，為說戒至他處，去者突吉羅。
translation: Because of this, he said to the Buddha, who said, You shouldn't preach the precepts on the day; if you preach the precepts for someone else and leave them there, it's a grave offense.

source_sentence: 聽所住處，若有平地、若有柔軟草、若有大樹、若有大盤石，應白二羯磨結作布薩處。」
translation: If you hear where to live, whether it's a level ground, a soft grass, a large tree, or a large flat rock, you should tell the two karmic bonds to make a poṣāya place.

source_sentence: 一比丘白：「大德僧聽！
translation: A monk said, Listen, great virtuous monks!

source_sentence: 今結此作布薩處。
translation: Now, we'll conclude here by making this a place for the bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 若僧時到僧忍聽。
translation: If the saṃgha arrives at the saṃgha's time, the saṃgha will tolerate listening.

source_sentence: 白如是。」
translation: The white is like this.

source_sentence: 「大德僧聽！
translation: Venerable monks, listen!

source_sentence: 今結此作布薩處。
translation: Now, we'll conclude here by making this a place for the bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 誰諸長老忍，默然；
translation: Those elders who tolerated it remained silent.

source_sentence: 若不忍者，說。
translation: If someone doesn't tolerate it, they say.

source_sentence: 僧已結作布薩處竟；
translation: Having assembled, the assembly accomplished its duty of preaching.

source_sentence: 僧忍，默然故。
translation: The monks tolerated it because they were silent.

source_sentence: 是事如是持。」
translation: These things are thus maintained.

source_sentence: 諸比丘於露地布薩，為風雨、蚊虻所困。
translation: The monks spread their robes in the open air and were trapped by wind, rain, mosquitoes, and gadflies.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「聽當中央房，來往易處，如上白二羯磨結作布薩堂。」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, Listen, let's go to the central room and make a poṣa hall for the two karmic bonds as explained above, wherever they come and go.

source_sentence: 諸比丘復欲羯磨眾多房作布薩處，以是白佛，佛言：「聽作！」
translation: The monks again wanted to make a poṣa for the many rooms in the karma, so they told the Buddha this, and he said, Listen!

source_sentence: 諸比丘便復諍先，以是白佛，佛言：「不聽羯磨眾多房作布薩處！」
translation: The monks then went back to the front and said this to the Buddha, who said, Don't listen to the explanation of the many rooms that make up the bodhisattva's place in the karma!

source_sentence: 有諸居士來入僧坊，語諸比丘：「若於我所作房中布薩者，我當供前食後食、怛鉢那，與塗足、塗身、然燈油。」
translation: Some householders came into the saṃgha's hall and said to the monks, If you make a poṣa in my room where I'm staying, I will offer food before and food after the meal, soap and oil, foot-applied oil, body-smearing oil, and lamp-light oil.

source_sentence: 諸比丘作是念：「若世尊還聽羯磨眾多房作布薩處者，不使我等失此供養。」
translation: The monks had this thought, If the Bhagavān were to return and listen to the kalpa's many rooms as a place for making offerings, we wouldn't lose this offering.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「還聽羯磨眾多房作布薩處，次第於中布薩。」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, and he said, Listen to the many monks in the Kālāma's room who make a poṣa of it, and they will place it in order.

source_sentence: 房小不相容受，以是白佛，佛言：「聽在前後檐、下庭中坐。」
translation: The monks in the small room didn't allow each other to receive it, so they said this to the Buddha, who said, Hear me sit behind the eaves or down in the courtyard.

source_sentence: 諸比丘聞聲，不了語，恐不成布薩。
translation: The monks heard the sound but could not utter it. They feared that they would not be able to make a sermon.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「若為布薩在中，得名布薩。」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, If a bodhisattva is present in it, he'll be called a bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 諸比丘布薩時不肯時集，廢坐禪行道。
translation: The monks were unwilling to assemble at the time of the precepts and abandoned their seats, meditation, and paths.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應唱時至，若打揵椎、若打鼓、若吹蠡。」
translation: He therefore told the Buddha, who said, When the time comes for you to sing it, if you beat the gong, beat the drum, or blow the Li.

source_sentence: 諸比丘便作金銀鼓，以是白佛，佛言：「應用銅、鐵、瓦、木，以皮冠頭。」
translation: The monks then made a gold and silver drum and reported it to the Buddha, who said, Use copper, iron, tile, wood, and leather for the crown of your head.

source_sentence: 不知誰應打，以是白佛，佛言：「應使沙彌、守園人打。」
translation: He didn't know who should be beaten and therefore told the Buddha, who said, You should have a novice or guard of the garden beat you.

source_sentence: 彼便多打，以是白佛，佛言：「應三通打。」
translation: They then beat him many times and therefore told the Buddha, who said, You should beat him three times.

source_sentence: 打竟，懸著中庭，外人來數打，諸比丘謂行僧事，皆出廢行道；
translation: When the beating was over, he hung it in the courtyard and beat it several times by outsiders. All the bhikṣus said they were engaged in religious activities but all of them abandoned religious practice.

source_sentence: 或雨濕不作聲。
translation: Some rain or moisture doesn't make a sound.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應舉屋下屏處。」
translation: He therefore told the Buddha, and he said, You should lift the seat under the roof.

source_sentence: 有客沙彌次打，不知處失時節。
translation: There was a guest śrāmaṇer who beat him next, but he didn't know the time and place to do so.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「舊住人應打，聽畜僧鼓、私鼓、四方僧鼓、備豫一鼓。」
translation: Because of this, he said to the Buddha, The old monks should be beaten and allowed to store the saṃgha's drum, private drum, four-pronged saṃgha drum, and prepare a drum.

source_sentence: 諸比丘又作金銀蠡，以是白佛，佛言：「應吹海蠡，若用角作。
translation: The monks also made a golden and silver grated, and they told the Buddha about it. The Buddha said, You should blow up an ocean grate; make it with horns.

source_sentence: 沙彌、守園人吹，乃至備豫一蠡，亦如上說。」
translation: The śrāmaṇer and the guardians of the grove blow it, even if they prepare a single Li, as explained above.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知以何木作揵椎，以是白佛，佛言：「除漆樹、毒樹，餘木鳴者聽作。
translation: The monks didn't know what wood to make the gandharva and therefore said this to the Buddha, who said, Except for the lacquer tree and poisonous tree, the other trees that sounded will be heard made.

source_sentence: 若無沙彌，比丘亦得打。」
translation: If there's no novice, the monk can also be beaten.

source_sentence: 餘如上。
translation: The rest are as above.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知誰應三唱時至，以是白佛，佛言：「聽使沙彌、守園人。」
translation: The monks didn't know who should come at the time of the three calls, so they said to the Buddha and he said, Listen, śrāmaṇeras and guards of the garden.

source_sentence: 僧住處多不得遍聞，以是白佛，佛言：「應上高處唱。」
translation: Where the saṃgha lived, they couldn't hear it all heard and therefore said to the Buddha, who said, You should go up high and sing it.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知為集、未集，以是白佛，佛言：「比坐比丘應更相語知。」
translation: The monks didn't know that they had gathered or hadn't yet gathered, so they said this to the Buddha, who said, That monk sitting next should tell them again.

source_sentence: 後有客比丘來不知，以是白佛，佛言：「應數之。」
translation: Later, a guest monk came along who didn't know and reported this to the Buddha, who said, You should count it.

source_sentence: 諸比丘數復忘，以是白佛，佛言：「應行籌，收取數之。」
translation: The monks again forgot the number and therefore reported it to the Buddha, who said, You should go ahead and count it.

source_sentence: 一人行，自收雜亂。
translation: When one person walks, he collects the confusion on his own.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應別使一人收。」
translation: He therefore told the Buddha, and he said, You should send one person to collect it separately.

source_sentence: 諸比丘便作金銀籌，以是白佛，佛言：「應用銅、鐵牙、角、骨、竹、木作，除漆毒樹。」
translation: The monks then made a gold and silver chip and presented it to the Buddha, who said, Use copper, iron teeth, horns, bones, bones, bamboo, and wood to make it, except for the poisonous tree of lacquer.

source_sentence: 諸比丘有短作、有長作，以是白佛，佛言：「短，應長竝五指；
translation: The bhikṣus said to the Buddha, “If it is short you should measure five fingers in length.

source_sentence: 長，應長拳手一肘。」
translation: It's long, and it should be one elbow long with its fist and hands.

source_sentence: 諸比丘作或麁或細，以是白佛，佛言：「麁不過小指，細不減斫。
translation: The monks made either small or fine pieces and reported this to the Buddha, who said, A ring is no more than a tiny finger; it's fine and doesn't decrease in size.

source_sentence: 應漆，以筒盛，懸著布薩堂上。」
translation: It should be painted, put it in a tube and hang it on top of the poṣa hall.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知誰應行籌，以是白佛，佛言：「應使下坐比丘行。」
translation: The monks didn't know who to carry the chip and therefore reported it to the Buddha, who said, You should allow the monk to walk downstairs.

source_sentence: 下坐比丘不知行，以是白佛，佛言：「應取知者。」
translation: The monk downstairs didn't know how to do it, so he told the Buddha, who said, You should take the knower.

source_sentence: 有比丘便擲籌與僧，以是白佛，佛言：「應手授。」
translation: A monk then tossed the chip to the saṃgha and reported it to the Buddha, who said, Give it to me with your hand.

source_sentence: 收已不數，數已不唱。
translation: After collecting it, he doesn't count it, and after counting it, he doesn't sing it.

source_sentence: 以是白佛。
translation: That's why he said to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛言：「收已應數，數已應唱。
translation: The Buddha said, You should count it after collecting it and sing it after counting it.

source_sentence: 唱云：『比丘若干，沙彌若干，出家合若干人。』」
translation: They called out, 'There are a number of monks, a number of śrāmaṇeras, and a number of people who leave home.'

source_sentence: 時有白衣聽布薩，後諸比丘犯罪，白衣舉之。
translation: A white-robed monk then listened to the precepts, and after the monks committed crimes, the white-robed ones lifted them up.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「不應令白衣聽，沙彌亦如是。」
translation: Because of this, he said to the Buddha, who said, You shouldn't allow white-robed people to hear it, and so should a novice.

source_sentence: 諸比丘雖遣沙彌在不見處，而猶得聞。
translation: Although the monks sent the novices to places where they weren't seen, they still heard it.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應著不見、不聞處。」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, You should be attached to a place where you don't see or hear.

source_sentence: 復有諸沙彌知當布薩，預入床下，猶得聞戒。
translation: Again, there were śrāmaṇeras who knew the precepts would be taught and entered under their beds, but they still heard the precepts.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應看床下，以火遍照。」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, You should look under your bed and illuminate it with fire.

source_sentence: 火照熏屋、或燒地敷，以是白佛，佛言：「應作燈籠、燈趺，僧及私畜皆得。」
translation: When a fire shone and perfumed the house or burned the floor, he said to the Buddha because of this, You should make a lantern or lamp post for it, and the saṃgha and private animals will all get it.

source_sentence: 諸比丘便以金銀作，以是白佛，佛言：「應用銅、鐵、瓦、木。」
translation: The monks then made it out of gold and silver and presented it to the Buddha, who said, Use copper, iron, tile, and wood.

source_sentence: 有諸白衣新作屋竟，請諸比丘先於中布薩說法，為入舍供養。
translation: When the newly built white-robed monks had finished building their new dwelling, they invited the monks to first preach the Dharma in the monastery and entered the dwelling to make offerings.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知云何？
translation: The monks didn't know what it was.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「聽受！」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, Listen and accept!

source_sentence: 復有白衣家為非人所惱，請諸比丘家中布薩、說法，以為安樂供養。
translation: Again, there were white-robed householders who were afflicted by non-people and invited the monks to their homes to preach and explain the Dharma in order to make offerings of comfort.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知云何？
translation: The monks didn't know what it was.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「聽受！」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, Listen and accept!

source_sentence: 有居士行甘蔗，諸比丘不敢受。
translation: A householder practiced sugarcane, and the monks didn't dare to accept it.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應受！」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, You should accept it!

source_sentence: 有諸居士問諸比丘：「今日幾？」
translation: Some householders asked the monks, How long is it today?

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知，便譏訶言：「沙門釋子日尚不知，何況深理？」
translation: Not knowing this, the monks criticized him, saying, The ascetic or Śākyamuni doesn't know it every day, so why wouldn't he?

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「若欲往白衣家，應先問師日數。
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, If you want to go to a white-robed house, you should first ask the master how many days it takes.

source_sentence: 師若不知，應問餘人。」
translation: If you don't know it, you should ask the others.

source_sentence: 時諸居士布薩日，持時食、時飲、七日藥、終身藥至僧坊供養，欲聽法，受八分戒。
translation: On the day of the upāsādhi, the monks were observing the eight parts of the precepts by taking food at the proper time, drinking alcohol at the proper time, medicine for seven days, and medicine for the rest of their lives to make offerings in the saṃgha hall.

source_sentence: 諸比丘都不看視，便瞋恚持歸。
translation: The monks didn't look around, so they became angry and took it back.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「上座應令下座掃地取水，使淨人辦器盛其所齎物。」
translation: He therefore told the Buddha, and he said, The superior monk should cause the inferior monk to sweep the ground for water and make a pure person prepare a container to contain what's brought.

source_sentence: 諸比丘食都不與客，客便譏訶言：「沙門釋子常讚歎布施，唯受人施而不施人。」
translation: The monks won't give food to their guests, and the guest criticizes them, saying, Sramanas and Śākyamunis always praise generosity, but they only receive it from others and don't give it to others.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應與客食。」
translation: He therefore told the Buddha, and he said, You should give it to the guest for food.

source_sentence: 既與，著其手中，不與器物，便譏訶言：「諸比丘作小兒遇我。」
translation: When he gave it, he put it in his hand and didn't give the container, and then he reprimanded him, saying, Monks, make a small child to meet me.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應與器物下食。
translation: Because of this, he said to the Buddha, who said, You should give it to the container and eat under it.

source_sentence: 食竟，上座、若上座等，為說法呪願。」
translation: After he finishes his meal, the superior seat or a superior seat will explain the dhāraṇī and vow for him.

source_sentence: 客去後，若四人、若過四人，應廣布薩。
translation: If there are four or more than four people after the guest's departure, they should spread it out in detail.

source_sentence: 若二人、若三人，應相向說淨言：「今僧十四日、十五日布薩。
translation: If there are two people or three people, they should speak to each other in a pure way, saying, Now, the saṃgha's fourteenth and fifteenth-day poṣad.

source_sentence: 我某甲比丘清淨，長老憶持！」
translation: I, a certain monk, am pure, and the elder remembers it!

source_sentence: 如是三說。
translation: These are the three teachings.

source_sentence: 若一人應小待，若有人來共布薩；
translation: If there is only one person, you should wait for a little while. Suppose someone comes and joins in the preaching together.

source_sentence: 若無人來，應偏袒右肩，胡跪合掌，心念口言：「今十四日、十五日眾僧布薩，我今心受布薩。」
translation: If there's no one to come, he should bare his right shoulder, kneel down with his palms pressed together, and think mentally and verbally, Now, on the 14th or 15th day, the saṃgha will give a sermon, and now I'll accept it with my mind.

source_sentence: 如是三說。
translation: These are the three teachings.

source_sentence: 告諸比丘：「是布薩法，從今應盡壽如是奉行，不者突吉羅。」
translation: He told the monks, This is the bodhisattva's teaching that should be practiced like this for the rest of one's life from now on; it's not a grave offense.

source_sentence: 時諸居士入僧坊問諸比丘：「僧有幾人？」
translation: The householders then entered the saṃgha's hall and asked the monks, How many people are there in the saṃgha?

source_sentence: 答言：「僧有若干？」
translation: He replied, Are there many saṃgha?

source_sentence: 彼言：「我等請僧明日食。」
translation: They said, We'll invite the saṃgha to eat tomorrow.

source_sentence: 諸近處比丘聞，明日盡往，坐席不足，飲食又少。
translation: When the monks in the nearby villages heard this, they all went there on the following day. There were not enough seats for them to take their seats and fewer food and drink.

source_sentence: 諸比丘言：「汝等請僧，何以不與我食？」
translation: The monks said, Why don't you invite the saṃgha to give me food?

source_sentence: 答言：「我昨問僧，隨數設食；
translation: He replied, Yesterday I questioned the Sangha and offered food to them as many times as possible.

source_sentence: 先不相請而強求索，不請而食，甚於外道。
translation: They didn't invite each other to ask for food and ate without being invited, much less the non-Buddhist.

source_sentence: 此輩無沙門行，破沙門法！」
translation: These people lack the practice of ascetics, and they break the ascetic's teaching!

source_sentence: 諸長老比丘聞，種種訶責，以是白佛。
translation: When the elder monks heard this, they reprimanded him in various ways and reported it to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛言：「不請不應往，往者突吉羅。」
translation: The Buddha said, You shouldn't invite them or go there; those who go there are the tukhilas.

source_sentence: 復有諸比丘以因緣事應會，日至請家，慚愧不敢。
translation: Again, there were monks who came to the house of the invitation for a reason and didn't dare to be ashamed or fearful.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「不為食，聽往。」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, Don't eat; listen and go.

source_sentence: 爾時有居士請僧食，有客比丘來。
translation: It was then that a householder invited the saṃgha to eat, and a guest monk came.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知云何？
translation: The monks didn't know what it was.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應語主人，有客比丘聽入不？
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, You should tell your host, 'Is there a guest monk who's allowed to enter?'

source_sentence: 若聽入善；
translation: If one listens to and enters into wholesomeness.

source_sentence: 若不聽，復應語言：『與我等食分，我自平等共食。』
translation: If you don't hear it, you should also say, 'Give me the portion of food that we eat, and I myself will eat equally together.'

source_sentence: 若得者善；
translation: Those who have attained it are good.

source_sentence: 若不得，應各以鉢受分，出外共食，若得者善；
translation: If you do not get it, you should each accept the portion with your bowl and go out to eat together. If you get it, it is good.

source_sentence: 若復不得，僧坊內有食，應將與之。」
translation: If you don't get it again, there's food in the saṃgha hall; you should give it to him.

source_sentence: 時世飢饉乞食難得，餘處比丘盡捨住處，集王舍城，僧房皆空，無人守護；
translation: When the world became hungry and food was scarce and difficult to obtain, all the other bhikṣus abandoned their dwelling places and assembled in Rājagaha. All the monks’ quarters were empty and no one guarded them.

source_sentence: 房舍臥具，或為火燒、或為水漬、或為虫嚙。
translation: The living quarters and bedding may be burned by fire, submerged in water, or caught by insects.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「近王舍城左右諸住處，皆應白二羯磨如上捨界，然後白二羯磨如上通結作一大界，使諸比丘不捨本住而得施分。」
translation: That's why he said to the Buddha, who said, To the left and right of the abodes near the city of Rājagṛha, you should tell the two karmas as above to abandon the boundary, and then tell the two karmas as above to form a large boundary so that the monks won't abandon their original abode and attain the almsgiving portion.

source_sentence: 後時餘處還復豐樂，思見比丘，遣信白言：「願遊人間，我等供給衣食。」
translation: At some point later, the other places were again abundant and happy, and he thought to see the monk and sent a letter saying, May I travel among the people, and we'll provide food and clothing for you.

source_sentence: 時瓶沙王亦欲令諸比丘遊行教化，語言：「願為遊行，若有乏短，當勅所在，供給所須。」
translation: The king of Vaiśravaṇa then also wanted to cause the monks to travel and teach, saying, May I go on a journey for their sake? If there's anything lacking, I'll order them to stay wherever they are and provide whatever they need.

source_sentence: 諸比丘以是白佛，佛言：「先白二羯磨如上捨王舍城大界，然後各隨意更唱界相，還結小界。」
translation: The monks therefore reported this to the Buddha, who said, First, they told the two karmas as above that they abandoned the great boundary of Rājagṛha and then each one would sing the characteristics of the boundary as they wished and return to the small boundary.

source_sentence: 有諸阿練若比丘不知己界應齊幾許，以是白佛。
translation: Some arhat monks who didn't know how many degrees their own boundaries should be the same, so they reported this to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛言：「自然界去身面二句樓賒；
translation: The Buddha said, “The realm of spontaneous nature is separated by two phrases: body and face.

source_sentence: 若結界，隨遠近。」
translation: If you form a boundary, follow it from near and far.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘結無邊界，以是白佛，佛言：「若結無邊界不成結界，犯者突吉羅！」
translation: The monks then formed the boundless boundary and said this to the Buddha, who said, If you form a boundless boundary that doesn't form a boundary, it's a grave offense!

source_sentence: 諸比丘復結十二由旬或十由旬界，說戒時往四五日行，乃至或遇野火、或遇暴水、或遇賊剝，便有梵行難、衣鉢難及命難。
translation: The monks then form another boundary of twelve or ten yojanas, traveling for four or five days when they preach the precepts, or even if they meet a wildfire, a storm of water, or a thief who takes advantage of them, there will be difficulties with religious practice, difficulties with their robes, bowls, and lives.

source_sentence: 爾時優波離與諸持律遊行，到比丘住處，應為作訶責羯磨、驅出羯磨、依止羯磨、舉罪羯磨、下意羯磨者，悉為作之；

source_sentence: 應為作別住、摩那埵、本日、阿浮訶那者，皆為作之。

source_sentence: 應為作教誡比丘尼羯磨，為作教誡羯磨；
translation: You should perform the ordination for the instruction of bhikṣuṇīs and the ordination for the instruction of bhikṣus.

source_sentence: 不堪教誡，應為解教誡羯磨，為解教誡羯磨。
translation: If they can't be instructed, they should explain the karma of instructing and the karma of instructing for their understanding.

source_sentence: 餘諸比丘聞，作是念：「此諸持律比丘來，必使我等多有疑悔。」
translation: When the other monks heard this, they thought, These monks who uphold the precepts will surely cause us to have many doubts and regrets when they come.

source_sentence: 便舉臥具閉戶，捨住處而去；
translation: He then lifted the bedding, closed the door, and departed leaving his dwelling place.

source_sentence: 又諸比丘尼見優波離，瞋罵言：「坐此比丘恒問世尊，此戒應作二部僧持、作一部僧持？
translation: Also, when the monks and nuns saw Upāli, they angrily abused him, saying, Sitting here, this monk always asks the Bhagavān, Should these precepts be upheld by two groups of monks or one group of monks?

source_sentence: 佛便令作二部僧持，由此使我多受困苦。」
translation: The Buddha then ordered two groups of monks to maintain it, which caused me to experience much suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 優波離所將比丘有先還者，佛如常法問已，又問：「優波離遊行處，供養豐足不？」
translation: When Upāli had returned before the monk whom he was leading, the Buddha asked in accordance with the usual rules and again asked, Is Upāli's place of traveling abundant for offerings?

source_sentence: 答言：「不足。」
translation: He replied, Not enough.

source_sentence: 又問：「何故？」
translation: Again, he asked, Why is that?

source_sentence: 具以諸比丘捨住處及比丘尼瞋罵答佛。
translation: It's because the monks abandoned their dwelling places and the bhikṣuṇīs angrily ridiculed the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛以是事集比丘僧，問彼諸比丘：「汝等實爾不？」
translation: Because of this, the Buddha gathered the monks and asked those monks, Is that true?

source_sentence: 答言：「實爾。
translation: He replied, Indeed.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 佛種種訶責：「汝等愚癡！
translation: The Buddha variously reprimanded them, You fools!

source_sentence: 不恭敬持律比丘，誰應恭敬？」
translation: If you don't respect the monks who uphold the precepts, who should respect them?

source_sentence: 訶已，告諸比丘：「今為諸比丘結初應學法。
translation: After he had reprimanded them, he told the monks, Now, for the sake of the monks, I've bound the first part of the teaching that should be studied.

source_sentence: 「若比丘聞持律比丘來，不應避去，應為掃灑，整理房舍、臥具；
translation: “If a monk hears that a bhikṣu who keeps the precepts is coming, he should not run away from it. He should sweep and clean his dwelling place and bedding.

source_sentence: 若聞欲至，出半由旬迎；
translation: When he heard that they were about to arrive, he came out half a yojana away to greet them.

source_sentence: 若有疑難，要當出門。
translation: If you have any doubts or difficulties, you must leave.

source_sentence: 若持律比丘有衣物應代擔，為辦澡洗水，拭手脚巾，為作浴具，設過中飲，請說法。
translation: If a monk who upholds the precepts has clothing to replace it, he should prepare water for bathing, wipe his hands and feet with towels, make bathing implements for bathing, set up a midday drink, and ask him to teach the Dharma.

source_sentence: 若實求解，持律比丘應如法答；
translation: If they really seek understanding, the monks who keep the precepts should answer in accordance with the teaching.

source_sentence: 若觸惱問，不應答。
translation: If he touches the question of affliction, he shouldn't answer it.

source_sentence: 明旦，為作前食、怛鉢那，次作後食；
translation: On the morning, he prepared the first and second foods for the assembly. Next, he prepared the latter food.

source_sentence: 應為求請主，請留安居；
translation: They should request hosts to invite them and ask them to remain in peace.

source_sentence: 復應為求施衣檀越，應作如是供養，若不爾，突吉羅！」
translation: Again, you should make such an offering to the donor who asks for a gift of clothing, and if you don't, pratyekabuddha!

source_sentence: 佛在王舍城。
translation: The Buddha was in the city of Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊布薩日與諸比丘前後圍繞露地而坐，告諸比丘：「汝等寂默，今當布薩，說波羅提木叉。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān, who was sitting with the monks in front and behind him on the day of the upāsāya, surrounded them to the bare ground and said to the monks, You're silent; now, you must upāsāya and explain the prātimokṣa.

source_sentence: 有一比丘從坐起白佛言：「伽伽比丘近得狂病，有時來，有時不來；
translation: One of the bhikṣus rose from his seat and said to the Buddha: The bhikṣu Kaṅga is seriously ill. At times he comes, but at other times he does not.

source_sentence: 亦復不憶來與不來，以是廢行僧事。
translation: Nor does he remember what came or didn't come, which is why he discarded the saṃgha's affairs.

source_sentence: 今復不來！」
translation: I won't come back now!

source_sentence: 佛言：「遣一比丘呼來！」
translation: The Buddha said, send a monk to summon him!

source_sentence: 受教往呼，遍求不得，還以是白佛，佛言：「今聽諸比丘遙與作狂白二羯磨。」
translation: They were instructed to call back, but they couldn't get all the requests and returned to the Buddha with this, who said, Now, I'll listen to the monks from a distance to perform the two crazy white karmas.

source_sentence: 一比丘白言：「大德僧聽！
translation: A monk said, Listen, great virtuous monks!

source_sentence: 此某甲比丘狂病，或來或不來，亦復不憶來與不來，以是廢行僧事。
translation: This certain monk is seriously ill, whether he comes or doesn't come, and he doesn't remember coming or not coming; this is why he discards the saṃgha's business.

source_sentence: 僧今遙與某甲作狂羯磨，若現在、若不現在行僧事。
translation: Now, the saṃgha is performing a crazy karman from a distance with a certain person, whether present or absent, to perform the saṃgha's work.

source_sentence: 若僧時到僧忍聽。
translation: If the saṃgha arrives at the saṃgha's time, the saṃgha will tolerate listening.

source_sentence: 白如是。」
translation: The white is like this.

source_sentence: 「大德僧聽！

source_sentence: 此某甲比丘狂病，乃至若不現在行僧事。
translation: This certain monk is seriously ill, even if he doesn't perform the saṃgha's duties in the present.

source_sentence: 誰諸長老忍，默然；
translation: Those elders who tolerated it remained silent.

source_sentence: 若不忍者，說。
translation: If someone doesn't tolerate it, they say.

source_sentence: 僧已與某甲作狂羯磨竟；
translation: The monks had finished performing the crazy karma-maṇḍa with that certain person.

source_sentence: 僧忍，默然故。
translation: The monks tolerated it because they were silent.

source_sentence: 是事如是持。」
translation: These things are thus maintained.

source_sentence: 彼後得差，求解羯磨，以是白佛。
translation: Later, he received the instruction and asked for an explanation of the karman, so he told it to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛言：「聽白二羯磨為解。」
translation: The Buddha said, Listen to the explanation of the two karmas as understanding.

source_sentence: 病差比丘應到僧中，偏袒右肩，脫革屣，胡跪合掌，白言：「大德僧聽！
translation: The sick monk should go to the saṃgha, bare his right shoulder, remove his leather sandals, kneel down with joined palms, and say, Listen, Venerable Monks!

source_sentence: 我某甲比丘先得狂病，或來或不來，亦復不憶來與不來；
translation: I, a certain monk, have previously suffered from an ailment of madness. Whether I come or don’t come, nor do I recall coming or not coming.

source_sentence: 僧已與我作狂羯磨。
translation: The saṃgha has given me a crazy karma-maṇḍa.

source_sentence: 我今已差，從僧乞解狂羯磨。」
translation: Now that I've sent it, I beg from the saṃgha to release the crazy karma.

source_sentence: 如是三乞。
translation: These are the three kinds of begging.

source_sentence: 應一比丘白：「大德僧聽！
translation: You should have one monk say, Listen, great virtuous monks!

source_sentence: 此某甲比丘先狂，或來或不來，亦復不憶來與不來；
translation: This certain bhikṣu had previously gone astray, either coming or not coming. Nor did he remember coming or not coming.

source_sentence: 僧與作狂羯磨。
translation: The saṃgha and the monks performed a crazy karma ceremony.

source_sentence: 今已差，從僧乞解狂羯磨；
translation: Now that I have sent it, I beg the Sangha to release me from this monk’s madness.

source_sentence: 僧今與解狂羯磨。
translation: Now, the saṃgha will give him the karman of liberation from the crazed.

source_sentence: 若僧時到僧忍聽。
translation: If the saṃgha arrives at the saṃgha's time, the saṃgha will tolerate listening.

translation: The white is like this.

source_sentence: 「大德僧聽！
translation: Venerable monks, listen!

source_sentence: 此某甲比丘先狂病，乃至僧今與解狂羯磨。
translation: This certain monk was previously ill with a madness, and now the saṃgha is giving him an explanation of the madness karma.

source_sentence: 誰諸長老忍，默然；
translation: Those elders who tolerated it remained silent.

source_sentence: 若不忍者，說。
translation: If someone doesn't tolerate it, they say.

source_sentence: 僧已與某甲比丘解狂羯磨竟；
translation: The saṃgha had completed the ordination ceremony for a certain monk to be released from crazedness.

source_sentence: 僧忍，默然故。
translation: The monks tolerated it because they were silent.

source_sentence: 是事如是持。」
translation: These things are thus maintained.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊布薩日與諸比丘前後圍繞露地而坐，告諸比丘：「汝等寂默，今布薩說戒。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān, who was observing the precepts with the monks and surrounded them in front and behind him on the bare ground, addressed the monks, You're being silent, but now you're observing the precepts.

source_sentence: 有一比丘從坐起，白佛言：「某甲比丘得病不來。」
translation: A monk rose from his seat and said to the Buddha, That certain monk won't come if he gets sick.

source_sentence: 佛言：「應令一比丘將來。」
translation: The Buddha said, You should cause one monk to come.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知云何將來？
translation: The monks didn't know what was coming.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「教拄杖、使人扶；
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, “May I ask you to support me with your staff and messengers.” The Buddha said:

source_sentence: 若不堪，以衣舁之。」
translation: If you can't bear it, use your robe to cover it.

source_sentence: 即受教舁來。
translation: That's when he received the teaching and came here.

source_sentence: 勞動故，病更困篤、或有死者。
translation: Because of their labor, illness becomes even more serious and some die.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應取清淨欲來。」
translation: He therefore told the Buddha, and he said, You should take the pure desire to come.

source_sentence: 是中或有得名與清淨欲，或有不得；
translation: Among these, some have acquisition of names and pure desires; some do not.

source_sentence: 或有得名受清淨欲，或有不得；
或有得名持清淨欲來，或有不得。
translation: Some people who attain the name and maintain pure desires may come, or some won't.

source_sentence: 不得名與清淨欲者：若與比丘尼、式叉摩那、沙彌、沙彌尼清淨欲；
translation: Those who do not get the name and give pure desires are:

source_sentence: 與狂心、亂心、病壞心、滅擯人、被舉人、自說罪人、異界住人清淨欲；
translation: He desires the purity of craving with a state of delusion, a state of confusion, a state of sickness and disintegration, extinguishing anger toward others, overpowering others, telling themselves to be sinners, living in different realms.

source_sentence: 若不如法三說：「我今與汝清淨欲，汝受我清淨欲，至如法僧事中，為我稱名說及捉籌。」
translation: If someone doesn't follow the three teachings of the Dharma, they say, Now, I give you pure desires, and you accept my pure desires, up to the point where, in the affairs of the saṃgha according to the Dharma, you call them by name for me, explain them, and grasp a chip.

source_sentence: 皆不名與清淨欲。
translation: They aren't called pure desires or pure desires.

source_sentence: 若反上名與清淨欲。
translation: If it's the opposite of the above, it's called pure desire and pure desire.

source_sentence: 不名受清淨欲者：自不如法、不識他姓名，餘如上，皆不名受清淨欲。
translation: They aren't called feeling pure desires because they don't follow the teaching themselves and don't know the names of others, and the rest are not called feeling pure desires.

source_sentence: 反此名受清淨欲。
translation: Instead, it's called feeling pure desire.

source_sentence: 得名持清淨欲來者：若持清淨欲比丘來至布薩中，便睡眠、若狂心、散亂心、病壞心；
translation: It gets the name “coming from holding pure desires”: If a bhikṣu who holds pure desires comes to the monastery, he will be sleepy, or have a mad mind, a distracted mind, or a sick and disintegrating mind.

source_sentence: 若僧與作不見罪羯磨、不捨惡邪見羯磨、不悔過羯磨；
translation: If the samgha does not make a kalpa of blameworthiness, a kalpa of not rejecting evil views, or a kalpa of not regretting faults.

source_sentence: 若變成二根、黃門、無根；
translation: If they become two faculties, the yellow-faced and the faculty without faculties.

source_sentence: 若忘說，是亦得名持清淨欲來。
translation: If someone forgets to explain it, they can also be called a follower of pure desire.

source_sentence: 若睡眠、若忘不說，皆犯突吉羅罪。
translation: If someone goes to sleep or forgets and doesn't explain it, they'll all commit the sin of a grave offense.

source_sentence: 若中路睡眠，乃至忘說，皆不得名持清淨欲來。
translation: If he's midway asleep or even forgets to explain it, they can't be called purified by maintaining the desire to come.

source_sentence: 復有諸病比丘，不能口語說清淨欲。
translation: Again, there are sick monks who can't verbally express pure desires.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應身與清淨欲。」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, You should give your body and pure desires.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知云何身與清淨欲？
translation: The monks didn't know what bodily and pure desires are?

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「若舉手、舉指、搖身、搖頭，乃至舉眼，得名身與清淨欲。」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, If someone raises their hand, raises their fingers, shakes their body, shakes their head, or even raises their eyes, they'll be called having a body and pure desire.

source_sentence: 復有諸病比丘不能身與清淨欲，以是白佛，佛言：「應舉眾到病人所，使說戒比丘於中央坐說戒，令諸病比丘向說戒人。」
translation: Again, there were sick monks who couldn't give their bodies and pure desires and therefore said to the Buddha, The Buddha said, You should summon the crowd to the sick man's place, make the precept-exhorting monk sit in the center and explain the precepts, and cause the sick monks to teach the precepts to him.

source_sentence: 復有諸病比丘不能向說戒人，背而坐臥。
translation: Again, there are sick monks who can't teach the precepts to others and sit or lie down with their backs turned.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應出界外布薩，不得在界內作別眾布薩。」
translation: Because of this, he said to the Buddha, who said, You should go outside the boundary to preach, but you mustn't make separate preachers inside the boundary.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊說戒日與諸比丘前後圍繞露地坐，告諸比丘：「汝等寂默，今當布薩說戒。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān explained the precepts to the monks and surrounded them in front and behind him, sitting quietly on the bare ground, and he told the monks, You're silent; now, you will expound the precepts in a bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 有一比丘從坐起，白佛言：「某甲比丘為官所執，不得來。」
translation: A monk rose from his seat and said to the Buddha, That certain monk is held by an official who won't come.

source_sentence: 佛言：「應遣一比丘語所由，求還布薩，若聽者善；
translation: The Buddha said: You should send a bhikṣu to the place where the bhikṣu delivered his discourse and ask him to return to precepts.

source_sentence: 若不聽，應語白衣小却，為取清淨欲，若得者善；
translation: If you won’t listen, you should tell the white-robed bhikṣu to retreat quietly in order to acquire pure desires.

source_sentence: 若不得，應語言：『一切僧當來就此比丘布薩。』
translation: If you can't, you should say, 'All the saṃgha will come here to this monk to make offerings.'

source_sentence: 若得者善；
translation: Those who have attained it are good.

source_sentence: 若不得，應出界外布薩，不得界內別眾布薩。」
translation: If you don't get it, you should go out of the boundary to preach it, and you won't be allowed to preach separately within the boundary.

source_sentence: 有一阿練若處，諸比丘十五日集布薩說戒。
translation: There was a place in a forest where the monks assembled on the fifteenth day to preach the precepts.

source_sentence: 時有賊來，諸比丘見，便止不誦戒。
translation: When a thief came, the monks stopped and didn't recite the precepts when they saw him.

source_sentence: 諸賊問言：「何故默住？」
translation: The thieves asked, Why are you staying silent?

source_sentence: 答言：「我等所說，不應使白衣聞。」
translation: They replied, We shouldn't allow white-robed people to hear what we teach.

source_sentence: 賊復問：「所說非佛語耶？」
translation: The thief then asked, Is what you say not the Buddha's words?

source_sentence: 答言：「是！」
translation: He replied, Yes!

source_sentence: 復問：「若是佛語，誰不應聞？
translation: Again, he asked, If this is the Buddha's words, who wouldn't hear them?

source_sentence: 汝等今集，必欲論說不利我等！」
translation: Now that you've gathered here, you must want to discuss it and say it won't work for us!

source_sentence: 便打，奪諸比丘衣鉢。
translation: He then beat him and snatched the monks' robes and bowls.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「從今諸比丘若見賊來，應即誦餘經，不令斷絕。」
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, From now on, if monks see thieves coming, they should recite the other sūtras so that they won't be cut off.

source_sentence: 爾時有王名優陀延，善知相法，有一夫人名月光，容顏姝妙，音妓兼人；
translation: At that time there was a king named Udayana, well versed in the physiological signs. There was a queen named Candraprabha with a graceful countenance and singing voice accompanied by human beings.

source_sentence: 後於高閣上，在王前舞。
translation: Later, on a high pavilion, he danced in front of the king.

source_sentence: 王見死相不出一年，諦視心念，顏色不悅。
translation: The king saw that the mark of death had not been visible for a year, and when he looked at it with deep attention his countenance was displeased.

source_sentence: 夫人覺之，便白王言：「我舞不好耶？
translation: Realizing this, the queen said to the king, Is it not good for me to dance?

source_sentence: 何以不悅？」
translation: Why isn't it pleasant?

source_sentence: 王言：「不須問我！」
translation: The king said, Don't ask me!

source_sentence: 夫人苦問至三，王不獲已，便具以告。
translation: The queen asked three questions in painful circumstances, but the king didn't get them, so he told them all.

source_sentence: 夫人白王：「若實爾者，願聽出家！」
translation: The lady said to the king, If that's true, may you be allowed to leave home!

source_sentence: 王言：「我相敬愛，死不相離，餘歡少日，如何生離？」
translation: The king said, We respect each other and love each other, but we won't part when we die; how can we part for the rest of the joyful few days?

source_sentence: 夫人復白王言：「少染世榮，迷味道業，即此促期，唯與苦會。
translation: The queen again said to the king, “I am not endowed with worldly prosperity and have been deluded by my past deeds of taste and action.

source_sentence: 願必垂愍，聽遂出家！」
translation: May you be disciplined and allow me to leave home!

translation: The king said, You're a young man who cultivates the path with insight and wisdom, and you'll surely be born in heaven.

source_sentence: 若還相見，當遂汝意。」
translation: If you return to see each other, you'll follow your wishes.

source_sentence: 夫人白言：「若此願果，誓不違要！」
translation: The lady said, If this vow is fulfilled, I swear it won't go against the essentials!

source_sentence: 便聽出家。
translation: He then heard that he had left home.

source_sentence: 於是辭去，行道不久得阿那含果，即便命終生於梵天，便作是念：「我得出家是王之恩，恩重宜報，要不可違。」
translation: Soon after he left, he practiced the path and soon attained the fruit of non-returning, and when his life ended and he was born in Brahmā Heaven, he thought, I'll leave home because this is a great favor from the king; it's important to repay that kindness without disobeying him.

source_sentence: 即下在王宮上，虛空中立，語王言：「月光夫人即我身是，先與王要，故來赴信。」
translation: He then descended to the king's palace, stood up in space, and said to the king, That's me, Lady Moonlight; I gave the king the essentials first, so I came to believe it.

source_sentence: 王語言：「我不識天，可現本身。」
translation: The king said, I don't know the gods, so I can show myself.

source_sentence: 即變為昔形，於王前立。
translation: He then took his old form and stood in front of the king.

source_sentence: 王見情重，欲附近之，便飛昇虛空，語王言：「王何故猶習此愛欲為？
translation: Seeing his affection, the king wanted to get close to him, so he flew up into the sky and said to the king, Why is it that you still indulge in this kind of craving?

source_sentence: 欲為無常、苦、空、不淨，若思此義可得解脫。
translation: Desire is impermanent, painful, empty, and impure, and if you contemplate this meaning, you'll attain liberation.

source_sentence: 若不爾者，必墮三塗，自拔良難！」
translation: If you don't, you'll surely fall into the three destinies and be pulled out of your own difficulty!

source_sentence: 王聞此語，心即調柔，即捨王位以付太子，出家學道，在城左右山林樹下。
translation: When the king heard these words, his mind became tempered and he relinquished his royal throne to the crown prince and renounced household life to study the path. He stayed at the foot of a forest tree in the mountains to the left and right of the city.

source_sentence: 太子見父出家而不遠去，恒恐變悔，還奪其位，常願父王遠之他國。
translation: The prince, seeing that his father had renounced the householder’s life but was not far away from home, always feared remorse and withdrew to take up his throne. He always wished that his father, the king, would be far removed from other countries.

source_sentence: 時王比丘作是念：「我奉佛教而未見佛，今當往彼禮敬世尊。」
translation: The king monk then thought, I've followed Buddhism but haven't seen the Buddha, so now I'll go there to pay homage to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 念已便行。
translation: After he's mindful, he then does so.

source_sentence: 時太子與諸婆羅門在高樓上見出林去，語新王言：「王比丘今已去矣！」
translation: The prince and the other brāhmaṇas then saw the prince leaving the forest in a high building and said to the new king, King, monk, you've already departed!

source_sentence: 太子欣悅。
translation: The prince was delighted.

source_sentence: 王比丘忘坐具，須臾憶之，即便還取。
translation: The king bhikṣu forgot his sitting cloth, remembered it for a moment, and then returned to take it.

source_sentence: 諸婆羅門復語新王言：「王比丘已復還，將無有以？」
translation: Again, the Brāhmaṇas said to the new king, The king's monk has returned again, but there's no reason for it?

source_sentence: 太子惶怖，便勅左右：「汝速往殺！
translation: Frightened, the prince ordered his aides, Go quickly and kill him!

source_sentence: 凡是沙門釋子亦盡殺之！」
translation: Whoever is an ascetic or a son of the Śākyamuni also kills them all!

source_sentence: 復勅言：「彼或畏死，多作方便，慎莫不殺而來見我！」
translation: Again, he said, Perhaps they're afraid of death and often do their best to avoid killing them and come to see me!

source_sentence: 受教即往，語言：「新王勅我殺比丘！」
translation: He was instructed to go there and said, The new king has ordered me to kill the monk!

source_sentence: 比丘問言：「何故殺我？」
translation: The monk asked, Why did you kill me?

source_sentence: 答言：「以比丘出林還反，恐奪其位，是以相殺。」
translation: He replied, It's because the monk left the forest and returned, fearing to snatch his position; therefore, they killed each other.

source_sentence: 王比丘言：「我不貪王位，向忘坐具，故暫還取。
translation: The king's monk said, I don't crave the king's throne; I forgot the sitting cloth and so returned to take it temporarily.

source_sentence: 如何以此，而便見殺？」
translation: How could you have seen him kill because of this?

source_sentence: 使復言：「重被王勅：『彼必畏死，多作方便，慎莫不殺而還見我！』
translation: The envoy again said, Again, I've been repeatedly instructed by the king, 'They will surely fear death and often do skillful means; be careful not to kill them and return to see me!'

source_sentence: 我今云何而得徒反？」
translation: How can I now attain the opposite of that?

source_sentence: 王比丘復言：「我出家所求未有所獲，汝小寬我，待彼樹影至。」
translation: The king monk again said, I've left home and haven't gotten anything to ask for, so please be generous to me and wait until the shadow of that tree arrives.

source_sentence: 使者聽之。
translation: The messengers listened to him.

source_sentence: 即懃思惟，得須陀洹。
translation: That's when he contemplates, and he attains stream entry.

source_sentence: 樹影既至，使者復語樹影已至，比丘復言：「我出家所求猶未盡獲，可復見寬，更待一影。」
translation: When the shadow of the tree arrived, the messenger again said, The shadow of the tree arrived, and the monk said, I've left home and haven't gotten enough to ask for, so I can still see that it's wide and wait for another shadow.

source_sentence: 使者復聽。
translation: The messenger then listened again.

source_sentence: 如是四反得四沙門果，便語使者：「汝可隨意，還語汝王，我不貪王位，行忘坐具，所以暫還。
translation: Having obtained the four fruits of śrāmaṇeṇahood for these four times, he said to his messengers, “Do as you wish. Tell your king that I do not covet the throne but rather forget my seat and bedding.

source_sentence: 汝為此殺我，便是殺父、殺阿羅漢，念汝長夜受大苦耳！」
translation: For this reason, you killed me, killing my father and the arhat, and remember that you've suffered great pain for a long time!

source_sentence: 言已就死。
translation: After he said this, he died.

source_sentence: 使者殺已還到王所，王遙見之即生悔心。
translation: The messenger returned to the king's place after killing him, and when he saw him from a distance, the king became remorseful.

source_sentence: 到已問言：「汝已殺耶？」
translation: When he arrived, he asked, Have you killed him?

source_sentence: 答言：「已殺！」
translation: He replied, I've killed!

source_sentence: 王復問言：「父王臨終有何所說？」
translation: The king again asked, What did the father say at the end of his life?

source_sentence: 使者嗚咽，具以上答。
translation: The messenger sobbed and gave the above answer.

source_sentence: 王聞此語血從口出，即以生身入大地獄。
translation: When the king heard these words, blood came out of his mouth and he entered the great hell with his flesh.

source_sentence: 時瓶沙王與其隣國，先聞其教盡殺沙門釋子，恐入己界，勅諸杖士守護比丘，杖士受勅動止不離。
translation: When King Bimbisāra and his neighboring country had heard their instructions, he killed all the ascetics and Śākyamunis, fearing to enter his own territory, and ordered the canoists to guard the monks, who were commanded to move and stop without leaving.

source_sentence: 時王舍城一住處有五百比丘，十五日集，語令小却：「我欲布薩。」
translation: At the time, there were five hundred monks in one dwelling place in Rājagṛha who assembled on the fifteenth day and told the order to retreat, I want to preach.

source_sentence: 杖士答言：「我等受勅不得暫離，豈敢公違大王之令？」
translation: The staffmen replied, We won't be allowed to leave for a while because of the command, so how dare we disobey the king's order?

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知云何？
translation: The monks didn't know what it was.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「若不肯去者，但說戒序竟，言：『餘僧所常聞。』
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, who said, If you won't leave, simply explain the preface to the precepts at the end of the precepts and say, 'The rest of the saṃgha always hear them.'

source_sentence: 應作如是布薩，不得不布薩。」
translation: You should make such a statement, but you mustn't make it.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘布薩日集欲說戒，六群比丘諍訟不住，不得說戒；
translation: When the bhikṣus of that assembly wished to preach the precepts, six groups of bhikṣus disputed with each other and did not stay. They could not preach the precepts.

source_sentence: 瓶沙王來便得暫止，去後續復共鬪，不得說戒。
translation: When the king of Vaiśravaṇa came, he was allowed to stay for a while. After going away, they fought each other again and were not allowed to preach the precepts.

source_sentence: 不知云何？
translation: I don't know what it is.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「若有如瓶沙王，比丘有所畏難，鬪暫止時，便說戒序。
translation: Because of this, he said to the Buddha, Suppose there's a monk with fear and difficulty like King Vaiśravaṇa, who explains the precepts when his fight stops for a while.

source_sentence: 說戒序竟，言：『餘僧所常聞。』
translation: After explaining the preface to the precepts, he said, 'The rest of the saṃgha always hear it.'

source_sentence: 應作如是布薩，不得不布薩。」
translation: You should make such a statement, but you mustn't make it.

source_sentence: 僧布薩時欲作羯磨，六群比丘受他清淨欲，竟不至僧中，便出界外，欲使僧羯磨不成。
translation: When the saṃgha was about to perform the karma, six groups of monks who had received pure desires from others and didn't go to the saṃgha but then left the boundary because they wanted to prevent the saṃgha from performing the karma.

source_sentence: 諸比丘以是白佛，佛言：「僧得成羯磨；
translation: The monks therefore reported this to the Buddha, who said:

source_sentence: 受他清淨欲者，犯突吉羅。」
translation: Anyone who receives the pure desires of others commits a grave offense.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘常略說戒，諸年少比丘言：「大德！
translation: The monks then always briefly explained the precepts, and the young monks said, Mañjuśrī!

translation: Explained in detail, we've never heard it before.

translation: If you don't, you should say, 'Now, when the fourteenth and fifteenth days of the bodhisattva's retreat are held, each shares his or her correct body, speech, and thought, so don't be careless!'

translation: This can also be called a bodhisattva.

translation: There is a certain dwelling place where, at the moment of preaching the precepts, there are also bhiksus who come:

source_sentence: 復有一住處，說戒竟，一切未起去，更有比丘來，若多、若等、若少；
translation: Again, there is another dwelling place where all those who have expounded the precepts do not arise or depart until they have done so. There will also come bhikṣus, whether many, equal, or few.

translation: “Furthermore, there is another kind of abode at the end of a discourse on the precepts in which there are bhikṣus who have gone forth and those who have not yet gone forth. There are also bhikṣus coming, whether many, equal, or few.

translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, “If there are any bhikṣus who come at the time of preaching the precepts, if they are numerous or equal [to them], you should also ordain another bhikṣu to preach the precepts.” The World-honored One replied:

translation: If it's small, he should kneel down among the saṃgha and speak purely.

translation: If after the preaching of the precepts has ended, there are some monks who go and those who have not yet gone. And if there are still other monks who come, whether numerous or equal, they should further expound the precepts in a separate sermon.

source_sentence: 若少，應求先比丘和合更布薩說戒，若得者善；
translation: If it is small, one should ask the former bhiksu to reconcile and further preach the precepts by means of another ordination.

source_sentence: 若不得，應出界外布薩，不應界內別布薩。
translation: If they don't get it, they should go out of the boundary to preach it, and they shouldn't preach separately inside the boundary.

source_sentence: 若說戒竟，一切比丘起去，更有比丘來，亦如是。」

source_sentence: 若舊比丘集，若舊比丘來、若客比丘來、若舊客比丘來；

source_sentence: 若舊客比丘集，若舊客比丘來、若舊比丘來、若客比丘來，若多、若等、若少，乃至一切比丘起去，皆如上說。
translation: If an old guest monk gathers, if an old guest monk comes, an old monk comes, an old monk comes, or a guest monk comes, whether many, equal, or few, and all the monks get up and leave, it's as explained above.
